frame.name: Correctness
frame.definition:
<def-root>A particular piece of <fen>Information</fen> is evaluated for its accuracy. The <fen>Degree</fen> of correctness may also be expressed. The <fen>Source</fen> of information may also metonymically stand in for the <fen>Information</fen>.
<ex>Is your reputation at risk due to <t>incorrect</t> <fex name="inf">information</fex>?</ex> <ex>If your dealership service people make such <fex name="deg">totally</fex> <t>wrong</t> <fex name="inf">claims</fex>, I would be uncomfortable trusting their warranty claims too.</ex> <ex>All users must verify the <t>correctness</t> <fex name="inf">of their own information.</fex></ex> <ex>We found <fex name="inf">all of his information</fex> to <m>be</m> <t>right</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Information
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Information</fen> matches or does not match the facts of the world.
<ex><fex name="inf">That statement</fex> is totally <t>incorrect</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The degree to which the <fen>Information</fen> matches or does not match the facts of the world.
<ex>Vague prophecies, interpreted with maximum latitude, are likely to appear <fex name="deg">at least somewhat</fex> <t>accurate</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition:
<def-root>The aspect of reality which is accurately modeled by the <fen>Information</fen>.
<ex>That claim may be factually <t>accurate</t> <fex name="dom">in terms of in vitro pharmacology</fex> but that may have no clinical relevance.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Parameter
FE.definition:
<def-root>The aspect of the <fen>Information</fen> which accurately models reality.
<ex>Don't select an option just because it contains <fex name="par">factually</fex> <t>correct</t> information about the clinical situation.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.</def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Source</fen> is the agent who holds the correct/incorrect information.
<ex><fex name="Source">He</fex> is correct</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Re-encoding
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame, which typically corresponds to a Means action within the frame.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>The way in which the <fen>Source</fen> is correct/incorrect.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Information</fen> or the <fen>Source</fen> is correct.</def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root>The physcial context that the <fen>Information</fen> is found in.</def-root>

FE.name: Communicative_force
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the <fen>Communicative_force</fen> or authority with which the target operates (often denoted by words such as "officially," "formally," "technically," etc.). </def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>The outcome of the correctness if the <fen>Source</fen> or <fen>Information</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root>The Topic about which the Source has accurate information.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: correct.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: free from error; true; right.

lexUnit.name: incorrect.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not in accordance with fact or particular standards; wrong.

lexUnit.name: correctness.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state or quality of correctness.

lexUnit.name: exact.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not approximated in any way; precise.

lexUnit.name: true.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: tautologically correct, or correct within an ascribed framework.
